newsitem.title: COLOMBIA: Brother of Cali cartel drug lords gets jail term.
newsitem.headline: Brother of Cali cartel drug lords gets jail term.

text.p: A brother of the leaders of Colombia's notorious Cali drug cartel has been sentenced to seven years and two months imprisonment on narcotics charges, judicial sources said on Wednesday.

They said the prison sentence for Jorge Eliecer Rodriguez Orejuela, who was arrested in February 1995, stemmed from his role in various drug-related crimes including his admission that he helped smuggle 265 pounds (120 kg) of cocaine out of Colombia between 1990 and 1991.

The prosecutor general's office had asked for an 11-year jail term for Rodriguez Orejuela, but it was cut back to just over seven years as part of an elaborate plea-bargaining agreement, the judicial sources said.

Brothers Gilberto and Miguel Rodriguez Orejuela, leaders of the criminal drug syndicate that once cornered 80 percent of the world's cocaine market, have been held since mid-1995 in a maximum security prison in Bogota.
Both have reportedly confessed to drug trafficking but their sentences have not been announced yet.
